intro: Memora paucifoliolata, commonly known as the few-leaved memora, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, simple leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. It typically grows in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and in wetlands. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological studies and native garden cultivation.
